dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 478 IH: IRGC Terrorist Sanctions Act of 2017
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Poe of Texas (for himself and Mr. Sherman) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To require the imposition of sanctions against Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the IRGC Terrorist Sanctions Act of 2017.

subsection.text: The President shall, not later than 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, designate Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps as a terrorist entity under section 1(b) of Executive Order 13224 of September 24, 2001, and impose sanctions against Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps under section 1(b) of Executive Order 13224 of September 24, 2001, or under any other provision of law, as applicable.

paragraph.text: The President shall submit to Congress a report that contains the results of the imposition of sanctions under subsection (a).
The report under paragraph (1) should be submitted in unclassified form, but may contain a classified annex.
